meanings.definition: The state or quality of being pinnate.
meanings.sent1: The pinnations of the leaf gave it a unique appearance.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the pinnations of various plants in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The pinnations of the tree seemed to dance in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork mimicked the pinnations of nature, creating a beautiful display.
meanings.sent5: The intricate pinnations of the fern were a marvel to behold.

meanings.definition: The arrangement of leaflets or lobes on a compound leaf in a feather-like pattern.
meanings.sent1: The pinnations of the compound leaf resembled delicate feathers.
meanings.sent2: She admired the pinnations of the fern as they spread out elegantly.
meanings.sent3: The pinnations of the plant looked like tiny green feathers waving in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The pinnations of the leaflets created a graceful and symmetrical design.
meanings.sent5: The intricate pinnations of the compound leaf added a touch of beauty to the garden.
